summary: A small memorial for a dear friend.
descriptionHtml:
[center][i][color=#ff0000][size=5]Do[/size][/color][/i][b][u][color=#ff0000][size=5] NOT[/size][/color][/u][/b][i][color=#ff0000][size=5] link this to other websites!

[/size][/color][/i][color=#ff0000][size=5][color=#f4f4f4][size=2]This mod was kept hidden previosuly due to the fact that it was linked onto a website which I deemed inappropriate due to the fact of the mods nature, however since I have recieved an apology from the admins in question from the website so I am once again putting it on visible.
Mind you this is not a mod I wish to become popular, it was a thing made for me to process as I sat down and created it a few hours after the burial was done.
Thank you.[/size][/color][/size][/color][i][color=#ff0000][size=5]

~Stalin Memorial~[/size][/color]


My beloved friend passed away just recently, and I wanted to make a memorial to keep within my game.

[/i]


[img]https://farm1.staticflickr.com/705/20809126200_07dd8202b2_n.jpg[/img]

"[i]Stalin looking at mum while she's building stuff[/i]"

'the stache game is strong in this one



----------------------------------------------------------------------------------




[b][color=#ff0000][size=3]About Stalin[/size][/color][/b]

Not longer than 2½ months after I moved into my very first apartment I decided to adopt myself a cat, I grew up without pets and always envied my friends who had companions of their own.

Said and done.

He always enjoyed resting in my lap and cuddle as I played Skyrim, also trying to swat dragons like a real Catvahkiin as I tried to restrain him from murdering my screen. Also he loved listening to the TESV soundtracks so he always kept purring whenever I put the speakers on, lying in my lap chilling like a real dragon slayer. Or maybe just because it was cozy and not the music, but you can always imagine.

He's named after his 'stache which was the first thing my friend shouted when she saw him, since after it has become an inside joke that our apartment and his cat-bed is/was named Stalingrad.

I had the pleasure of caring for him for 2½ years before he unexpectedly fell desperately ill and passed in less than 36 hours.
[size=1]Nothing could be done.
All I can say is at least he didn't suffer for very long, but it breaks my heart.[/size]

Rest in peace my dear.


~


This memorial is for me, but I felt I wanted to share it if anyone wants to have pretty little addition to the Falkreath Graveyard.
As well as I have a couple of friends on here who have met him.[/center]
[center][b][size=3][color=#ff0000]Content:[/color]
[/size][/b]
Similar to [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/63583/?]Bear - In memory of Taylor[/url].
Although this is nowhere far as elaborate, I still felt that I needed to do this in order to process the situation.



[b][color=#ff0000][size=3]What about you?[/size][/color][/b]


I don't care if it's incompatible with any city or graveyard-mods, more as well as I don't use any city overhauls.

This is for me so I can process my grief, not for your sake.



[b][color=#ff0000][size=3]Credits:[/size][/color][/b]
[url=http://tesalliance.org/forums/index.php?/files/file/1329-insanitys-headstones/]Insanitysorrow[/url] for the grave meshes.

DarkMatter88 sent me a lovely mail with a custom text for the headstone.
I am so very grateful and moved by the gesture so I just had to update the mod so it would be included.



Thank you[/center]

[Edit]
2017-06-02

Do NOT link this to other sites!
author: MsFrankenstein
